comment: Bought at Schonefeld airport in Berlin on Sunday 28th February after an amazing three days in Berlin! Cost €32.90, great saving in duty free! Opened on May 28th 2016, and first drunk that night with kick off of the Champions League final between Real Madrid and Athletico Madrid at the San Siro.

The nose is quite disappointing, smells rather cheap and harsh. The taste is just a little better, with a hint of orange. I must add a splash of water to enjoy this whiskey, it takes away the hard edge.

Should have invested a few extra dollars to get a 12YO Glenlivet rather than what feels like a travel exclusive reject.
A very solid scotch for a beginner. Goes down very smooth and very enjoyable, but could have more character.
Got two bottles and love the smell of the whiskey. The taste is nice and not too intense. So enjoy an easy to drink whiskey.
Butter and cheese in the nose. Spicy taste with an oily finish. Not my favorite style of scotch whisky.

Surprised by the clear pear aroma on the nose, which is wonderful. There was also pear in the taste, especially after adding a touch of water. There was some bitterness in the taste that  I found rather pleasing - something like orange peel. Long finish.
Nose is rather underwhelming, quite sharp and almost like a blend. Fruity on the tounge but finish has a lot of burn so water is required.

Eye: medium gold
Nose: mild
Pallet: Very mild
Finish: short, strong
sterk ettersmak som ble tydelig mildere med en dråpe vann i. Eller så har den et fruktig preg
Bright gold in color with a pink hue, nose is creamy with hazelnut, pear. Palate is smooth, sweet, and creamy with fudge and fruit. Finish is short, cream and nutty
appelsin og pære. veldig myk og søt med høy viskositet. beskjeden malt og ganske kort. sødmelag blir værende i munnen. lett å drikke men meget uinteressant og søt.
Strong dried pear aroma with wild honey. Light malt, very smooth. Sweet with hay, marshmallow flavors. Tannins at the end. Very pleasant
Heathrow on the way to Athens. Fruity.
BA Lounge London, nice light easy, decent with food
Bought one when living in S.Korea...No impression at all /2+

"The (good) surprise of a tasting with 11 whiskies. Very quaffable! It reminds me a lot of balvenie doublewood 12 with its full body and strong sherry influence.

I was pretty sure this would be a crap whisky before I tried. What a great surprise! "
Tried this in late January. Delicate.
Nice scotch, smooth and light with a carmelle aftertaste.
Great peaty nose with a straight pour, open up the nose to get more floral with a drop of water.

Time to try my first The Glenlivet! Which means I've returned to Speyside. Master Distiller's Reserve is 40% ABV NAS and I consider it on the entry-level shelf. This is tripple cask matured and it shows in the notes too.

On the nose I got a clear pear note that was ripe and a bit sweet with orchard honey. I was aware people got pear notes from The Glenlivet, I just didn't think they would be so clear! Fudge notes came through.

My palate did pick up a fair amount of oak from the start which I'm a fan of. It mingled with general spice and did have some tangy pear notes in the back as well. 

The finish for me mainly offered notes of sherry, with tannins that were more bitter than dry, spices still present.

Compared to the nose and palate notes the finish was not as complex. Something I've noticed from 40% ABV NAS drams. It was still enjoyable and I will have this as a pleasant casual sipper!

Instagram: mr.ljwhisky
Needs more character and structure. Boring except the sharp finish. Still can make a easy drink for starters.

Nose: Strong honey, oak, vanilla, slight grape, roasted nuts

Taste: strong oak presence, citrus and vanilla, benefits from a drop of water and airing out

May 2018
When I initially tasted this I thought it was a bit like the Balvenie 12yo Doublewood but subsequent visits have dampened that impression. It has a fruity (pear) aroma and the palate is also fruity but mild, with a sharper (but not overlong) aftertaste.
A 3 to 3.5 stars is what I'd pitch it and, once finished, not one I'd return to.
Smooth and delicious. I'm new to these, but this is damn good!
Good triple cask. Not my favorite taste. The sherry flavor of the first cask is not really present.
Smooth, sweetness classic oak, very good

Smell:butterscotch,honey
Smoky, Allspice, light white pepper, salt, toffee, light oak, cherry

Geruch: Süß; Birne und Toffee, so ein bisschen wie Sahnetoffee. Ziemlich fruchtig. Bisschen würzig. 

Geschmack: Birne, Orangen, marmeladig im Abgang, zartbitter, Sherry, Abgang auch nussig und Marzipan/Mandeln

Mouthfeel: Etwas dicker und voller
Not very good. This is definitely a dumping ground for almost un-sellable whisky. Young, spirit-driven, with very little character.
Very tasty. Complex, classic speyside flavours, a slight hint of must, honey, sherry, sweet, white wine. Love it. $35 1L Bottle.

This is the cheapest expression of Glenlivet's Master Distiller's Reserve editions for travel retail. 40%abv.

On the nose: new Wood, Herbal notes, wet Forest, dim Vanilla.

On the palate, Oak and Pepper. Thats it. Aftertaste medium, pepper and clove. 

Needed to add water to see if it can give something else: 

Water opens a dim and "spicy" apple on the palate

Overall i give this dram a 78 over 100
Smooth, light, refreshing with ice. Would buy again
Nice flavors, dark fruits, floral, woody. Could be more interesting though
